name: Technical Documentation Evaluation Criteria
description: Specialized criteria for evaluating technical documentation, API docs, and code explanations

criteria.name: technical_accuracy
criteria.description: Correctness of technical information and concepts
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate the technical accuracy of the response. Are the technical concepts, APIs, and implementations correct?

examples.1: Contains major technical errors or incorrect information
examples.3: Mostly technically accurate with minor errors
examples.4: Technically accurate with no significant issues

criteria.name: implementation_feasibility
criteria.description: Whether proposed solutions are practically implementable
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Assess whether the proposed solutions, code examples, or technical approaches are practically implementable. Are they realistic and achievable?

examples.1: Proposed solutions are not implementable or unrealistic
examples.3: Most solutions are implementable with minor issues
examples.5: All solutions are highly implementable and well-thought-out

criteria.name: best_practices
criteria.description: Adherence to established best practices and standards
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate whether the response follows established best practices, coding standards, and industry conventions.

examples.1: Does not follow best practices or standards
examples.2: Some best practices followed but many violations
examples.3: Generally follows best practices with minor violations
examples.4: Follows best practices well with few issues
examples.5: Exemplary adherence to best practices and standards

criteria.name: completeness
criteria.description: Thoroughness of technical explanation or solution
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Assess how completely the technical explanation covers all necessary aspects. Are all required details included?

examples.2: Covers some aspects but misses important details
examples.4: Comprehensive technical coverage with minor gaps
examples.5: Thoroughly covers all technical aspects with appropriate detail

criteria.name: clarity
criteria.evaluation_prompt: Evaluate how clear and understandable the technical explanation is. Is it accessible to the target audience?

examples.2: Somewhat unclear with technical jargon issues
examples.3: Generally clear with minor unclear points
examples.5: Exceptionally clear with excellent technical communication
